▶️ EXPERIMENT

Sidebar

select your module name the Lab_directory = AGI_GUI_DIR / “your selected module” where Agi_LAB_DIR is the variable from ~/.env. If it has not been set then the default value is: “~/agilab/framework/AGILab”

the relative path of your dataframe the absolute path will be Agi_EXPORT_DIR / “your input dataframe relative path” where Agi_EXPORT_DIR is the variable from ~/.env. If it has not been set then the default value is: “~/export”

Select the nobebook file you want to import in the “Main Content Area”

This is an optional field in case your are not connected to internet but you want to get some snippet to work with.

If you have explicitly ask in your query to log the run for MLFlow then you can open MLFlow UI to extend your experimentation

This is similar to a cell in a notebook
This is the name of the name of the notebook file to export your experimentation
This button will save your dataframe, otherwise the result of your run will not be persistent
This button will save the export in the Nobebook-file

This will open an new tab with Nobebook-file into jupyter notebook

Main Content Area

Enter you query to online ChatGPT in natural langage and a python snippet will be generate See also EDIT/PRE-PROMT if you want to customize the pre-promt for your application

The history of queries for reuse purpose
